analysis.summary: The contract poses several high risks: unlimited liability for the Developer, significant termination penalties and no cure period, perpetual confidentiality obligations with heavy penalties, and challenging payment terms for the Client. These factors elevate the overall risk level of the agreement.

clauses.originalText: Developer's liability under this Agreement is unlimited and uncapped. Developer shall be liable for all direct, indirect, consequential, incidental, and punitive damages arising from or related to the services provided.
clauses.plainLanguageExplanation: Developer is responsible for all possible damages related to their work, with no upper limit.

clauses.originalText: Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time without cause by providing written notice. Upon termination: - Client retains all work product and intellectual property - Developer must immediately cease all work - Developer forfeits any unpaid invoices - Developer must pay Client a termination penalty equal to 30% of the total contract value - No cure period is provided for breach of contract
clauses.plainLanguageExplanation: Either party can cancel the contract at any time without needing a reason. If canceled, Client keeps all work and Developer has to stop working immediately and pay penalties.
riskReasons: Termination at will with no notice requirement

clauses.originalText: Developer agrees to maintain the confidentiality of all Client information indefinitely, with no time limit. This obligation survives termination of this Agreement. Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, all business information, technical data, trade secrets, know-how, research, product plans, products, services, customers, customer lists, markets, software, developments, inventions, processes, formulas, technology, designs, drawings, engineering, hardware configuration information, marketing, finances, and other business information. Developer shall not disclose any Confidential Information to any third party under any circumstances. Breach of this confidentiality obligation shall result in liquidated damages of $500,000 per incident.
clauses.plainLanguageExplanation: The Developer must keep all of Client's information secret forever. Breaking this promise will result in a large monetary penalty.

clauses.originalText: Client agrees to pay Developer according to the following schedule: - 50% upfront payment upon contract signing - 25% upon completion of Phase 1 - 25% upon final delivery Payment is due within Net 60 days of invoice date. Late payments shall incur a fee of 8% per month. All payments are non-refundable. Client must pay a 20% retention holdback for 90 days post-delivery.
clauses.plainLanguageExplanation: Client must pay half the contract amount upfront, with remaining payments as work progresses. Payment is due 60 days after billing, with high penalties for late payment and a holdback applies.
riskReasons: High late payment fee (8% per month)
